results.title: Put yourself in the picture
results.brief_description: Witness upper primary students as they try their hand at first time directing. This short tape briefly covers everything from how to take the lens cap off and load the video camera, watching the director at work, getting the best take, editing, sound and improvising. One thing is for sure, what they lack in years they make up for in confidence and enthusiasm towards putting themselves and their schoolfriend’s in the picture.

results.title: Puss in boots
results.brief_description: One of Lotte Reiniger’s early silhouette films, recreating the well-known fairytale in black and white cut-outs manipulated on a glass-topped table. Production: Carl Koch, Louis Hagen, Vivian Milroy. Design and animation: Lotte Reiniger. Music: Freddie Phillips.

results.title: Push and pull: simple machines at work
results.brief_description: All machines, no matter how complicated are made up of combinations of simple machines. This program examines six types of simple machines: the lever; the wheel and the axle; the pulley; the incline plane; the screw; the wedge. Each simple machine is fully explained in a way that the young student can easily follow. Using examples familiar to children, along with computer graphics and animation, the program covers the basic principles of physics that govern simple machines. Video support notes included. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students.

results.title: Push
results.brief_description: This engaging work explores the narrative device of ‘what if?’ to create a quirky and fun filled piece demonstrating sophisticated control of compositing in a playful exploration of the possibilities of technology.

results.title: Push
results.creator_credit: Wombat Productions, Inc., Gene Feldman and Urs Furrer
results.brief_description: The extraordinary dependence on the push-button is the subject of this unnarrated view of American society. Focuses on the familiar push-buttons found in everyday life, showing that while some technological advances are destructive, others are vitally needed.

results.title: Purse Seining: a new Australian fishery
results.brief_description: The film refers to and shows some of the aerial and sea surveys of the pelagic fish resources off the Australian Coast, undertaken bby the Divsion of Fisheries, CSIRO. Describes in detail the use of the purse-seine net in catching mackerel off the Tasmanian coast.
